title: Fire Strikes UASC’s Flagship Vessel
text:
17 Sep 2015 Cargo Volumes and Throughput , Environment , Going Places , Mega Ship Ready , Security and Logistics , Shipping A fire has broken out upon the 18,800 TEU UASC Barzan shortly before the 400 metre giant was due to dock at the Port of Felixstowe, UK, according to Arabian Supply Chain. 
The massive vessel was rerouted to Europe’s biggest port, the Port of Rotterdam, for inspection after the crew were forced into action to combat the fire. 
There have been no reported injuries, yet the incident is a blow for UASC, with Barzan renowned for being one of the most modern mega-size containerships in the world, being LNG ready and rated by UASC as the world’s most environmentally friendly ship. 
It is unclear how long the cargo aboard Barzan will be suspended from delivery at Felixstowe, although estimates are around two weeks. 
This is the second fire to hit a USAC vessel in as many weeks after 36 fire-fighters were called to tackle a blaze on the UASC Alula at the Port of Hamburg. 
Fires in and around ports have become a huge issue recently after the horrific scenes in Tianjin Port, China, where 159 people lost their lives. 
Shortly before this incident, the TT Club warned that few incidents that occur in terminals are “unpreventable”.
